nodes.bodyText: I would mention in the comments that the ID for a Gist can be non-numeric, e.g. "aa5a315d61ae9438b18d" - that is why we have special behaviour for getId() in this class.

nodes.bodyText: Should this have a justification = "..." setting?

nodes.diffHunk:

         /**
          * Set up the request parameters or POST payload.

nodes.bodyText: Do the unit tests include both null and not null scenarios?
Yes. Most scenarios are null.  Only the Gist scenario are not null here.
Maybe mention the purpose of this class in a comment, e.g. a helper class to update the Gist, since it is more convenient than using a LinkedHashMap, etc.
Maybe mention the purpose of this class in a comment.
Maybe mention what is the expected final type/content of "body"?
Would this cast ever fail? I.e. do we need the try? If so, is a catch required?
Loses some clarity if it is just "Object" instead of "InputStream".

It needs to be object, unless what you mean is that we should add a separate field for private final Object bodyObject; and keep the InputStream body as well.   I don't really see the point of the that though. You can't have both.
The alternative would be to have to allow the addition of an object to args with the key "".  This would a signal to set the root object to passed as body.

Could it break existing client code to introduce a possible exception?
Mind you, if clients are currently using this method they are probably getting an incorrect result, anyhow.
